image.altText: Underwater Rugby players

props.synopsis: As temperatures soar, advocates of public pools in Canberra say they want to see greater support and investment for facilities in the national capital.

title.children: 'Trend is they're going': Concerns for the future of Canberra's public pools

image.altText: A woman in ski gear, at the snow.

props.synopsis: At a time when many Aussies are heading off for beach holidays, a group of snow sports athletes are chasing winter with their sights set on the next Olympic Games.

title.children: No summer break for Australian athletes chasing Winter Olympic glory

image.altText: The wreck of a vehicle near a road.

props.synopsis: Police say the driver of the car was cut from the wreck and taken to hospital but died a short time later.

title.children: Wanted man dies in head-on truck crash after police pursuit

image.altText: Cartoon of Anthony Albanese sitting alone in the Speaker's chair in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: The annual showcase of the year's top political cartoons has opened at Old Parliament House in Canberra, depicting the biggest national and global events with satire and wit.

title.children: 'A lot to poke fun at': The best political cartoons of 2025

image.altText: Stuffed animals, wilted flowers, picture frames, and heartfelt messages left on the trunk of a tree next to a road.

props.synopsis: Nowra man Lachlan Stuckey is facing three charges of dangerous driving occasioning death over a single-vehicle car crash which killed three of his friends near Tarago in July last year.

title.children: Family of woman killed in Tarago crash say driver has 'shown no remorse'

image.altText: A blue bus travelling through Canberra's city centre

props.synopsis: The ACT government says the bus network will change from term 1 next year as it flags major disruption from work on Commonwealth Avenue Bridge.

title.children: 'Go out for dinner': Free fares for summer amid Canberra construction chaos

image.altText: A phone screen showing social media apps.

props.synopsis: The High Court of Australia agrees to hear a special case brought by two teenagers challenging the federal government's upcoming social media ban for Australians under 16.

title.children: High Court agrees to hear teens' challenge to social media ban

image.altText: Sarra and Craig Saxon-Gill who lost their home in the fire at Koolewong

props.synopsis: Residents on the NSW coast are coming to terms with property loss after bushfires swept through the region on Saturday.

title.children: This NSW couple were prepared for bushfires. They lost everything

image.altText: Pete Hegseth speaking with his hands slightly raised.

props.synopsis: What happened in the lead-up to a second strike on a speedboat in the Caribbean — who knew what and when, and who gave what order — is now under scrutiny.

title.children: The US fired on survivors clinging to a 'drug boat' — who gave the order?

image.altText: Oscar Piastri stands on his own

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri missed out on winning the Formula 1 drivers world championship by just 13 points to his teammate Lando Norris, the culmination of multiple small moments throughout the season that cost him dearly.

title.children: Piastri came so close, but these minor moments are what let the F1 title slip away

image.altText: Two cricketers on a pitch

props.synopsis: The snarl on Steve Smith's face proves conclusively that Australia doesn't just want to beat the English in this Ashes series. It wants to break them.

title.children: England has poked the bear. Australia is out for Ashes domination

image.altText: A woman with dark hair wearing a grey pinafore dress stands in front of triple j's sign

props.synopsis: Sexual violence prevention group Teach Us Consent is pushing for Australians to have the choice to "opt-in" to social media algorithms.

title.children: How would your social feed look if you controlled what you saw?

image.altText: A professional woman speaks in front of an EU flag backdrop.

props.synopsis: The European Union says it will learn from Australia's new laws to bar under-16s from social media, with steps to implement the world-first ban already underway and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen praising Australia's "brave move".

title.children: The EU has voted in favour of a teen social media ban, but not like Australia's

image.altText: A view across a wide street of an attractive, two storey goldrush-era corner building with lattice ironwork.

props.synopsis: For its passionate members, saving a historic goldrush-era pub to protect their cooperative was about "economic democracy" and keeping the property out of developers' hands.

title.children: A 'broken' property market spurred hundreds of locals to buy a building

image.altText: South Australian Liberal MP Ashton Hurn outside parliament.

props.synopsis: South Australian Liberal MP Ashton Hurn has secured her party's leadership months out from the next state election.

title.children: Ashton Hurn confirmed as new SA Liberal leader

image.altText: Jillian in a gingham top, with short brown hair, on the phone, standing in her kitchen.

props.synopsis: Jillian Hishon has devoted hundreds of hours, listening to an estimated 280 victims of historical child sexual abuse from within the fundamentalist Christian church she grew up in.

title.children: Exploitation and sexual abuse claims in Christian sect emerge via hotline

image.altText: A skull and bones sign laying on top of rubble with red tape going across and a destroyed building in the background

props.synopsis: Today marks one year since the Assad dictatorship in Syria was toppled by Islamist rebels, bringing an end to nearly 14 years of civil war. Some are celebrating, while others continue to struggle.

title.children: How the rebels who ousted Bashar Al-Assad are running the new Syria

image.altText: several volunteers who joined the russian armed forces line up ready to board a plane

props.synopsis: Through a targeted social media campaign, Russia is offering citizenship and money to foreigners who join its fight in Ukraine, but experts say it is a desperate measure.

title.children: Foreigners recruited by Russia end up in 'Moscow meat grinder'

image.altText: A man wearing a blue shirt and Akubra hat sitting with a black kelpie on his lap.

props.synopsis: From hit series Muster Dogs to a new television show, Frank Finger and his beloved kelpie Annie's unbreakable bond steals the spotlight once again.

title.children: Frank Finger and beloved muster dog Annie's emotional final TV appearance

image.altText: Regan Huitema walking up a street.

props.synopsis: When Regan buys his first home, the government will own around 30 per cent of it. But he is fast realising that for that to even happen, a lot of things have to fall into place.

title.children: First-home owner's highest offer declined as seller 'put off' by government scheme

image.altText: GFX of Reserve Bank of Australia exterior laid over generic ASX images

props.synopsis: Expectations of a rate cut pushed Wall Street higher, while the ASX looks unlikely to follow that positive lead. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX set to slip ahead of RBA rates decision this week

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX slips on opening, weighed down by miners
National Storage agrees to a $4 billion takeover

image.altText: A drone view of brown water and the affected area of a flash flood.

props.synopsis: Hit by deadly floods, Indonesians in the region around Aceh Tamiang are grappling with worsening diseases and a lack of medical care at the lone hospital in the area.

title.children: 'Everything destroyed' as Indonesia's Aceh grapples with disease after floods

image.altText: Donald Trump shaking hands with Vladimir Putin

props.synopsis: The strategy argues the US should revive the 19th century Monroe Doctrine, which declared the Western hemisphere to be Washington's zone of influence.

title.children: Kremlin praises Trump's national security strategy

image.altText: A carer pushes Connie. Both are smiling.

props.synopsis: Parents of some of Victoria's most vulnerable people fear what will happen to their loved ones if hundreds of group homes are forced to close.

title.children: Families 'devastated' amid fears of Victorian group home closures

image.altText: Silhouettes of two women and a man in front of a faded medical office

props.synopsis: Two women have told the ABC they believe the health regulator is failing to acknowledge the power imbalance between doctors and patients.

title.children: Woman 'gobsmacked' by regulator's response to pap smear complaint

image.altText: A red bun filled to the top with maggots all over it

props.synopsis: Perth residents say they are dealing with an "infestation of maggots" and stinking rubbish after the introduction of a third bin for food and garden waste. But the local council is adamant it will not be making any changes.

title.children: Perth's new bin rules bring maggots and bad smells to angry residents

image.altText: Ribbons tied to fence.

props.synopsis: Newcastle and Ballarat are 1,100 kilometres apart but share a dark bond — scores of suicide deaths linked to historical Catholic clergy abuse.

title.children: Cities 1,100 kilometres apart share dark bond linked to abuse

image.altText: A woman at a computer with a transgender flag in the background.

props.synopsis: Victoria Police fought a legal battle with a transgender woman for more than two years before admitting it incorrectly referred her to men's support services.

title.children: Trans woman took on police and won after being referred to men's help service

image.altText: An oval sign under a shop verandah saying sacat.

props.synopsis: The South Australian government is trying to speed up the transfer of hospital patients into aged care, but advocates say they are "trampling on the rights of older people" in the process.

title.children: Exploitation fears over SA government aged care changes

image.altText: A woman smiles as she is embraced by another woman.

props.synopsis: Jessica Stenson breaks the Australian marathon record before an emotional phone call to the former record holder, Sinead Driver.

title.children: 'We just cried': Stenson breaks marathon record in emotional scenes

image.altText: Rory McIlroy looks on at the Australian Open.

props.synopsis: Rory McIlroy's appearance at the Australian Open in Melbourne has gone a long way to restoring the prestige of the tournament.

title.children: McIlroy completes Australian Open mission even if he did not lift trophy

image.altText: Victorian police officer from behind

props.synopsis: A legal challenge is launched against a "designated area" declaration for Melbourne's CBD that gives police greater powers to search people without a warrant.

title.children: Legal challenge to police designated area declaration for Melbourne CBD

image.altText: Green lilypads and grasses line the edge of the River Murray.

props.synopsis: Water needs for river communities will be under increasing pressure over the next 25 years, according to predictions from the Murray-Darling Basin Authority.

title.children: Grim outlook for river spanning four states if nothing is done to combat climate's impact

image.altText: A blonde woman wearing a green jacket with looking stern

props.synopsis: South Australian Liberal frontbencher Ashton Hurn will run for her party's leadership, following the shock resignation of Vincent Tarzia just months out from the next state election.

title.children: Ashton Hurn to run for SA Liberal leadership following Tarzia departure

image.altText: China's first aircraft carrier, the Liaoning, sails into Hong Kong for a port call

props.synopsis: Japan formally protests the incident, calling it "an extremely regrettable" and dangerous act that "exceeded the scope necessary for safe aircraft operations".

title.children: Japan and Australia urge calm after Chinese radar locks onto Japanese jets
